document.text: Mrs. Aldah Barlow Gordon, j 50, Clerk of the Circuit Court of Appomattox County, died at 955 a.m. Monday in Lynchburg J General Hospital after a long illness. She was the wife of James Leslie Gordon, Jr . Born in Appomattox County, she was a daughter of Mrs. Mattie Pearl Gunter Barlow of Appom attox and the late Kenneth Vane Barlow. Mrs. Gordon was a member  of Liberty Baptist Church, where she taught the Adult II Sunday School Class and was a member of the church choir and the Joanna maiden Circle. She also was a member of Appomattox Womans Club and the Bicentennial commission. She served in the Clerks Office of Appomattox County for 29 years. She was deputy clerk until Aug. 1, 1964, at which time she was appointed clerk. She was a member of the Virginia Court Clerks Associa tion. In addition to her husband and mother, she is survived by a daughter, Miss Claudia Ann Gordon of Appomattox two sisters, Mrs. Elmina Guill and Mrs. Nina Beasley of Appomat tox, and two brothers, Warren Barlow of Mesa, Ariz., and Fred Barlow of Fitchville, Conn. Funeral services were held at 11 a.m. Wednesday at Liberty Baptist Church, with burial in Liberty Cemetery. Robinson Funeral Home was in charge of arrangements. TOPS was founded on the theory that obesity is an incurable lifelong affliction for many, but like diabetes, alcoholism and other afflictions it is controllable.
